cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles N of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwestward, forecast to turn north on Sunday and accelerate northeast toward Bermuda early next week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells impacting northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico; strongest winds expected near Bermuda
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds remain well north of Puerto Rico; only breezy conditions expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring brief squalls with 1â€“2 inches of rain, but widespread heavy rainfall is unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents on north-facing beaches of Puerto Rico.
